Module PunchingMachine
Package fr.univtours.polytech.punchingmachine.controller

Class PunchingSender

java.lang.Object
fr.univtours.polytech.punchingmachine.controller.PunchingSender
public class PunchingSender extends Object
This class is used to send the packets to the server when possible. If the connection is not available, the packets are saved in a file and sent later. The file is saved every 15 minutes and loaded when the application is started. A packet "not sent" is a packet that was not sent directly to the server. When we want to send a new packet, PunchindSender send all the packets not sent before. Only the information of the new packet is displayed to the user.

  • Method Details

    • setSocketConfigurations

      public void setSocketConfigurations(InetSocketAddress socketConfiguration)
      Setter for the socket configuration
      Parameters:
      socketConfiguration - the socket configuration to reach the server

    • sendPacket

      public void sendPacket(fr.univtours.polytech.punchingcommon.model.PacketPunching packet)
      Try to send the packet and show the result to the user. If there is packets not sent, they are sent before the new packet. If the connection is not available, a message is shown to the user and the packet is saved for later.

    • sendPackets

      public boolean sendPackets()
      Send the packets not sent to the server
      Returns:
      true if there is no remaining packets, false otherwise

    • serializePackets

      public void serializePackets()
      Serializes the packets to a file

    • deserializePackets

      public void deserializePackets()
      Deserializes the packets from a file

    • startSendLaterTimer

      public void startSendLaterTimer()
      Starts a timer to send packets in 15 minutes

    • onExit

      public void onExit()
      Called when the application is closed. Saves the packets not sent to a file and stop the timer to send them.
